intro: Anthistiria imberbis, commonly known as the smooth anthistiria, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant is distinguished by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
